messages.subject: [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/4/01
messages.msgSnippet: April 4 Chico Enterprise Record : Rhabdomantis couldn t stop top county speller http://www.chicoer.com/display/inn_news/news3.txt April 3 Contra Costa Times
messages.messageBody:
April 4
Chico Enterprise Record : 'Rhabdomantis' couldn't stop top county speller
http://www.chicoer.com/display/inn_news/news3.txt

April 3
Contra Costa Times (AP) : One-time homeless student gets top score on five
SATs
http://www.contracostatimes.com/news/california/stories_statebrk/perfectscores

_20010403.htm

Des Moines Register : Ankeny schools look at policy again
http://www.dmregister.com/news/stories/c4780927/14269859.html
More discussion of district funding for dual-enrollment students.

April 2
Herald : Monroe boy headed for Australia as sports envoy
http://www.heraldnet.com/Stories/01/4/2/13603454.cfm

April 1
Tuscaloosa News : There's no place like home
http://www.tuscaloosanews.com/news/stories/4116newsarchivedstorypage.html
"We take our schoolwork very seriously," Andria Williams [a homeschooling
mom] said. "I think home-schooling should be done correctly."
"The majority of [homeschoolers] choose to home-school for religious reasons,
according to Craig Young, a home-school parent in Loveland, Colo., and a
senior editor at the magazine Homeschooling Today."

Minor mentions:

April 4
Star Tribune : Coon Rapids teen wins state spelling bee
http://www2.startribune.com/stOnLine/cgi-bin/article?thisStory=83914757

April 3
St. Petersburg Times : Pasco students win scholarships, Bookmark contest
http://www.sptimes.com:80/News/040301/Pasco/Pasco_students_win_sc.shtml

Anchorage Daily News : Chugiak makes the rounds with 'Camelot'
http://www.adn.com:80/metro/story/0,2633,254364,00.html

Charlotte Observer : His smile inspired everybody he met
http://www.charlotte.com/observer/local/gaston/pub/gerry0403.htm

April 2
Bangor Daily News : Bapst scholar state chess champ
http://www.bangornews.com/cgi-bin/article.cfm?storynumber=31593
